breakfast.name: Peanut Butter Banana Oats
benefits: Slow-releasing energy from oats keeps you full through the morning.
Healthy fats and protein from peanut butter help with weight maintenance and muscle repair.
Milk adds calcium and extra protein.
Banana and honey provide natural sugars for a gentle energy boost.
instructions: Boil oats in milk until soft (~5 mins).
Stir in peanut butter and honey.
Slice banana on top.
Optional: add cinnamon or flax seeds for extra fiber.

lunch.name: Chicken Rice Bowl
benefits: High protein from chicken supports lean body mass and tissue repair.
Brown rice gives long-lasting energy and fiber for digestion.
Avocado and olive oil provide heart-healthy fats.
Broccoli adds antioxidants, vitamins C and K.
Greek yogurt boosts gut health and adds calcium.
ingredients: Cooked brown rice – ¾ cup (160 kcal)
Greek yogurt (low-fat, plain) – 2 tbsp as sauce (45 kcal)
instructions: Layer rice, veggies, and chicken in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil.
Top with Greek yogurt dressing and avocado.

dinner.name: Creamy Egg Pasta with Veggies
benefits: Whole wheat pasta provides fiber and complex carbs for sustained energy.
Egg adds complete protein and essential nutrients like choline and vitamin D.
Spinach offers iron, folate, and fiber for overall vitality.
Cheese and milk contribute calcium and taste to support bone health.
Olive oil aids the absorption of fat-soluble vitamins.
ingredients: Whole wheat pasta – 1 cup cooked (175 kcal)
instructions: Cook pasta and sauté onion/garlic in olive oil.
Add spinach and milk to the pan.
Mix in cheese and stir until creamy.
Toss pasta in the sauce and top with sliced boiled egg.

breakfast.name: Honey Almond Banana Yogurt Bowl
benefits: Rich in protein, healthy fats, and energy-packed carbs.
ingredients: Full-fat Greek yogurt – ¾ cup (135 kcal)
instructions: Layer Greek yogurt in a bowl.
Add sliced banana and oats.
Sprinkle almonds, chia seeds, and drizzle with honey.
Stir and enjoy chilled or room temp.

lunch.name: Avocado Chicken Wrap with Veggie Sticks
benefits: High in protein and healthy fats, supports energy and satiety.
instructions: Lay out the wrap, layer with veggies, avocado, and chicken.
Drizzle olive oil, top with cheese, roll and toast lightly.
Serve with cucumber or carrot sticks on the side.

dinner.name: Egg Fried Rice with Tofu and Veggies
benefits: Balanced plant-protein, healthy fats, and comforting meals.
ingredients: Firm tofu – ½ cup cubed (90 kcal)
Mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, bell peppers) – ½ cup (40 kcal)
instructions: Heat sesame oil, add garlic, onion, tofu and veggies.
Push to side of pan, scramble egg in the same pan.
Add cooked rice, soy sauce, and stir-fry all together.

breakfast.name: Creamy Banana-Peanut Butter Oats
benefits: High in healthy fats, fiber, and natural sugars
Provides slow-releasing energy for a productive morning
Good source of calcium, potassium, and omega-3s
instructions: Cook oats in milk until soft (~5 mins).
Stir in peanut butter and honey.
Top with sliced banana and chia seeds.

lunch.name: Creamy Chickpea & Quinoa Bowl with Feta and Roasted Veggies
benefits: Complete protein from quinoa + chickpeas
Fiber-rich and great for digestion
Feta adds calcium and flavor without too many calories
Healthy fats from olive oil and tahini for energy
ingredients: Roasted sweet potato – ½ cup (90 kcal)
Olive oil (for roasting & drizzle) – 2 tsp (90 kcal)
Spinach or kale (lightly sautéed or raw) – 1 cup (15 kcal)
Lemon juice or tahini (optional dressing) – 1 tbsp (20 kcal)
instructions: Roast sweet potato cubes in 1 tsp olive oil at 200°C (400°F) for 20–25 mins.
Cook quinoa and season lightly with salt or herbs.
In a bowl, layer quinoa, chickpeas, roasted sweet potatoes, greens, and feta.
Drizzle with remaining olive oil and lemon juice or tahini if desired.

dinner.name: Egg & Veggie Creamy Pasta Bowl
benefits: Balanced with complex carbs, protein, and fats
Supports muscle and bone health
Iron from spinach helps with energy metabolism
ingredients: Cooked whole wheat pasta – 1 cup (175 kcal)
Grated cheese (cheddar or mozzarella) – 2 tbsp (110 kcal)
instructions: Cook pasta and set aside.
Sauté garlic/onion in olive oil. Add spinach and milk.
Stir in cheese until creamy.
Mix in pasta and top with sliced boiled egg.

breakfast.name: Peanut Butter Banana Smoothie + Boiled Egg & Toast
benefits: High in protein and healthy fats for muscle support
Sustains energy with complex carbs and natural sugars
Rich in calcium, potassium, and fiber
instructions: Blend banana, milk, peanut butter, chia seeds, and honey into a smoothie.
Serve with a boiled egg and toast on the side.

lunch.name: Chicken Quinoa Bowl with Roasted Veggies & Yogurt
benefits: Complete protein from quinoa + chicken
Boosts immunity and digestion
Great source of iron, fiber, and vitamins
ingredients: Roasted carrots, bell pepper, and zucchini – ½ cup (90 kcal)
instructions: Roast vegetables with olive oil and a pinch of salt.
Assemble chicken, quinoa, and veggies in a bowl.
Serve with yogurt and drizzle lemon juice if preferred.

dinner.name: Sweet Potato, Lentil & Egg Power Bowl
benefits: High in fiber, protein, and iron
Ideal for post-activity muscle recovery
Great for gut health and heart function
ingredients: Boiled or roasted sweet potato – ½ medium (100 kcal)
Feta or grated cheddar cheese – 2 tbsp (110 kcal)
instructions: Boil or roast sweet potato.
Sauté spinach with garlic in olive oil.
Assemble lentils, sweet potato, spinach, and sliced egg in a bowl.
Top with cheese and herbs

breakfast.name: High-Protein Banana Oat Pancakes with Nut Butter
benefits: Packed with protein, fiber, and healthy fats
Sustained energy and blood sugar stability
Great for muscle support and weight maintenance
instructions: Blend banana, oats, eggs, and milk into a batter.
Pour onto a pan and cook pancakes until golden.
Serve with peanut butter and a drizzle of honey.

lunch.name: Grilled Chicken & Avocado Rice Bowl
benefits: High in lean protein and fiber
Combines good fats and complex carbs
Excellent for energy and satiety
ingredients: Steamed broccoli & carrots – ½ cup (40 kcal)
instructions: Layer rice in a bowl.
Add grilled chicken and vegetables.
Top with avocado and yogurt.
Drizzle olive oil and season as desired.

dinner.name: Lentil Pasta with Spinach & Egg + Side Salad
benefits: Rich in plant-based protein and iron
Balanced macros for evening nourishment
Supports recovery, brain function, and gut health
ingredients: Cooked whole wheat pasta – 1 cup (175 kcal)
Mixed greens salad (no dressing) – handful (20 kcal)
instructions: Sauté spinach and lentils with olive oil.
Toss with cooked pasta and cheese.
Serve with boiled egg and side salad with lemon-olive dressing.

breakfast.name: Oatmeal with Banana, Peanut Butter & Chia + Boiled Egg
benefits: Provides healthy fats, protein, and fiber
Great for long-lasting energy and satiety
Helps support muscle growth and brain health
instructions: Cook oats in milk until soft.
Stir in peanut butter and honey.
Top with sliced banana and chia seeds.
Serve with boiled egg on the side.

lunch.name: Grilled Chicken & Quinoa Bowl with Avocado and Yogurt Dressing
benefits: High in lean protein and good fats
Supports gut health, immunity, and strength
Rich in iron, fiber, and essential vitamins
instructions: Layer quinoa as the base.
Top with grilled chicken, avocado, and veggies.
Mix yogurt with lemon juice and herbs as dressing.
Drizzle olive oil before serving.

dinner.name: Creamy Lentil & Sweet Potato Pasta Bowl + Salad
benefits: Combines plant protein, fiber, and complex carbs
Supports energy levels and recovery
Good for bone and heart health
ingredients: Whole wheat pasta – 1 cup cooked (175 kcal)
Roasted sweet potato – ½ cup (100 kcal)
Spinach sautéed in olive oil – ½ cup (30 kcal)
Mixed greens salad + lemon dressing – 1 cup (60 kcal)
instructions: Roast sweet potato with a drizzle of olive oil.
Mix lentils, sweet potato, and spinach into the cooked pasta.
Stir in cheese and mix until creamy.
Serve with a fresh salad on the side.

breakfast.name: Nutty Banana Smoothie Bowl + Toasted Egg Sandwich
benefits: Great combo of protein, carbs, and healthy fats
Smooth digestion and sustained morning energy
Supports muscle and brain function
instructions: Blend banana, milk, peanut butter, oats, honey, and chia seeds into a thick smoothie.
Pour into a bowl and top with a few nuts/seeds.
Serve with a boiled egg and toast on the side.

lunch.name: Grilled Chicken & Avocado Quinoa Bowl + Fruit Yogurt
benefits: Complete meal with protein, fiber, and micronutrients
Aids in muscle recovery and bone health
Avocado and olive oil help absorb fat-soluble vitamins
instructions: Layer quinoa, veggies, and chicken in a bowl.
Top with avocado slices and olive oil drizzle.
Serve yogurt with fresh fruit slices for dessert.

dinner.name: Creamy Lentil Pasta with Roasted Veggies + Egg & Cheese
benefits: Rich in plant-based protein and complex carbs
Cheese and eggs offer calcium and B12
Excellent for muscle support and energy
ingredients: Whole wheat pasta – 1 cup cooked (175 kcal)
Roasted sweet potato – ½ cup (100 kcal)
Cheddar or mozzarella cheese – 2 tbsp (110 kcal)
instructions: Roast sweet potato and sauté spinach in olive oil.
Toss cooked pasta with lentils, sweet potato, cheese, and greens.
Top with sliced boiled egg and drizzle a little extra olive oil if needed.

breakfast.name: Banana Nut Butter Smoothie + Boiled Egg & Toast
benefits: Packed with fiber, protein, and good fats
Provides long-lasting energy
Supports muscle repair and satiety
ingredients: 2 slices of whole grain toast (140 kcal)
instructions: Blend banana, milk, peanut butter, oats, chia seeds, and honey into a smoothie.
Serve with boiled egg and toast.

lunch.name: Grilled Chicken & Avocado Rice Bowl + Yogurt
benefits: Balanced with complex carbs, lean protein, and good fats
Boosts energy, immunity, and gut health
Ideal for muscle and bone support
instructions: In a bowl, layer brown rice, chicken, veggies, and sliced avocado.
Drizzle olive oil and season with herbs/lemon.
Serve yogurt on the side

dinner.name: Creamy Lentil & Egg Pasta with Side Salad
benefits: Combines plant and animal proteins
Fiber-rich for digestion and energy
Supports overall strength and recovery
ingredients: Cooked whole wheat pasta – 1 cup (175 kcal)
Spinach sautéed in olive oil – 1 cup (60 kcal)
Mixed salad + lemon dressing – 1 cup (60 kcal)
instructions: Cook pasta and mix with lentils, sautéed spinach, and cheese.
Top with sweet potato and sliced boiled egg.
Serve with a fresh salad and lemon-olive dressing.

breakfast.name: Banana & Peanut Butter Oatmeal
benefits: High in energy, healthy fats, and fiber
Supports brain development and energy balance
Gentle on digestion
ingredients: Full cream milk – ½ cup (75 kcal)
instructions: Cook oats in milk until creamy.
Stir in peanut butter and honey.
Top with banana slices and chia seeds.

lunch.name: Rice, Egg & Veggie Bowl
benefits: Balanced carb-protein-fat meal
Provides vitamins A, D, and protein
Easy to chew and digest
ingredients: Cooked white or brown rice – ½ cup (110 kcal)
Steamed carrots & peas – ½ cup (50 kcal)
instructions: In a bowl, mix rice, chopped egg, and steamed vegetables.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with cheese.

dinner.name: Creamy Lentil Pasta
benefits: Plant-based iron and protein
High in calories and easy to eat
Ideal for evening digestion
ingredients: Cooked red lentils – ¼ cup (90 kcal)
instructions: Cook pasta and mix in cooked lentils.
Add olive oil and cheese, stir until creamy.

breakfast.name: Banana Oats with Peanut Butter & Milk
benefits: High in energy and fiber
Includes healthy fats and protein
Great for brain and body development
instructions: Cook oats in milk until soft.
Stir in peanut butter and honey.
Top with banana slices and chia seeds.

lunch.name: Tuna & Avocado Whole Wheat Wrap
benefits: High-quality protein from tuna and yogurt
Healthy fats from avocado and olive oil
Whole grains and veggies offer fiber and essential vitamins
Great for muscle recovery, brain support, and energy
ingredients: Canned tuna in water – ½ can (60g, drained) (90 kcal)
Greek yogurt (plain, for spread) – 2 tbsp (45 kcal)
Grated carrot & lettuce – ¼ cup mixed (10 kcal)
instructions: In a bowl, mash the tuna and avocado together with yogurt, olive oil, and a splash of lemon juice.
Lay the whole wheat wrap flat and spread the tuna-avocado mix in the center.
Top with shredded carrot and lettuce.
Roll it up and toast lightly if desired.

dinner.name: Mini Pasta Bowl with Lentils & Cheese
benefits: Combines plant-based protein and healthy fats
High in iron and fiber
Supports energy levels and digestion
ingredients: Cooked whole wheat pasta – ½ cup (110 kcal)
Cooked red lentils – ¼ cup (90 kcal)
instructions: Mix lentils with pasta and olive oil in a pan.
Add cheese and spinach, stir until warm and creamy.

breakfast.name: Whole Wheat Pancakes with Fruit & Yogurt
benefits: Rich in complex carbs for steady energy
Contains protein and healthy fats for growth and repair
Yogurt provides calcium and gut-friendly probiotics
Naturally sweet and satisfying with no added sugar
ingredients: Whole wheat flour – ½ cup (200 kcal)
instructions: In a bowl, whisk egg, flour, and milk until smooth.
Heat olive oil in a pan and cook pancakes until golden on both sides.
Top with sliced banana, a dollop of yogurt, and a drizzle of honey.

lunch.name: Tuna Pasta Salad Bowl
benefits: Protein-rich from tuna, yogurt, and cheese
Complex carbs from pasta for steady energy
Healthy fats from olive oil
Full of vitamins, fiber, and calcium
Light, refreshing, and perfect for digestion
ingredients: Cooked whole wheat pasta – ¾ cup (170 kcal)
Chopped cucumber & cherry tomatoes – ½ cup (20 kcal)
Plain Greek yogurt (for dressing) – 2 tbsp (55 kcal)
instructions: Mix the cooked pasta with drained tuna, sweet corn, cucumber, and tomatoes.
In a small bowl, mix Greek yogurt with a bit of lemon juice and pepper for a creamy dressing.
Pour yogurt dressing over the pasta salad and toss.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle grated cheese on top.

dinner.name: Sweet Potato, Chickpea & Egg Power Bowl
benefits: Rich in fiber, complex carbs, and protein
Sweet potato provides beta-carotene and slow-releasing energy
Chickpeas and egg support muscle repair and fullness
Feta adds calcium and a tasty finish
ingredients: Roasted sweet potato – ½ cup (100 kcal)
Sautéed kale or spinach – ½ cup (30 kcal)
instructions: Roast sweet potato cubes with a little olive oil until golden.
Warm the chickpeas with sautéed greens in a pan.
Add all to a bowl with sliced boiled egg and crumbled feta on top.
Drizzle with lemon juice or sprinkle herbs for added flavor.

breakfast.name: Banana Peanut Butter Smoothie + Egg & Toast
benefits: Boosts energy and focus
Excellent mix of protein, fiber, and healthy fats
Keeps you full throughout the morning
instructions: Blend banana, milk, oats, peanut butter, chia seeds, and honey until smooth.
Serve with a slice of toast (optional: spread a little butter or more PB).

lunch.name: Chicken Quinoa Bowl with Yogurt Dressing

instructions: Layer quinoa, chicken, and veggies in a bowl.

dinner.name: Lentil & Veggie Pasta with Egg and Cheese

instructions: Cook pasta and stir in lentils, spinach, and olive oil.

Contains fiber, healthy fats, and antioxidants
Keeps you full and focused throughout the morning

Mixed berries (fresh or frozen) – ½ cup (35 kcal)
instructions: Layer yogurt, oats, berries, and sliced banana in a bowl.
Drizzle with almond butter, honey, and sprinkle chia seeds.

Easy to prepare and very filling
ingredients: Whole wheat pasta – ¾ cup cooked (165 kcal)
Grated mozzarella or cheddar – 2 tbsp (110 kcal)
Cherry tomatoes or bell peppers – ½ cup (35 kcal)
instructions: Cook pasta and set aside.
Sauté spinach and cherry tomatoes in olive oil.
Mix lentils, veggies, and pasta, then stir in cheese until melted and creamy.

breakfast.name: Oatmeal Bowl with Peanut Butter, Banana & Chia + Boiled Egg

instructions: Cook oats in milk until soft.

instructions: Cook pasta and sauté spinach, peppers in olive oil.
Mix lentils, cooked pasta, and cheese until creamy.

breakfast.name: Banana Peanut Butter Oat Pancakes + Boiled Egg
benefits: Packed with fiber, protein, and healthy fats

instructions: Blend oats, banana, egg, and milk into a batter.
Cook in olive oil like pancakes.
Top with peanut butter, honey, and chia seeds.
Serve with boiled egg on the side.

instructions: Arrange rice, chicken, and veggies in a bowl.

instructions: Sauté spinach and tomatoes in olive oil.

instructions: Assemble chicken, rice, avocado, and veggies in a bowl.

benefits: Balanced in macros and rich in iron, fiber, and calcium
Supports overnight recovery and digestion

Grated cheddar or mozzarella – 2 tbsp (110 kcal)
Bell peppers or tomatoes – ½ cup (45 kcal)
instructions: Sauté spinach and bell peppers in olive oil.
Mix with lentils and pasta.
Stir in cheese and top with boiled egg slices.

Serve in a bowl topped with extra banana or nuts if desired.

benefits: Combines lean protein, healthy fats, and complex carbs

Berries or fruit slices – ½ cup (80 kcal)
instructions: In a bowl, layer rice, chicken, avocado, and veggies.
Drizzle with olive oil and season lightly.
Serve yogurt topped with fruit on the side.

dinner.name: Lentil & Cheese Pasta Bowl with Egg + Roasted Veggies
benefits: Nutrient-packed, protein-rich vegetarian-friendly dinner
Great for recovery, gut health, and blood sugar balance
Comforting and easy to digest
ingredients: Whole wheat pasta – 1.5 cups cooked (260 kcal)
Roasted sweet potato or pumpkin – ½ cup (100 kcal)
instructions: Toss cooked pasta with sautéed spinach, lentils, and olive oil.
Stir in cheese until creamy.
Top with boiled egg and serve with roasted veggies.

breakfast.name: Strawberry Power Smoothie + Scrambled Egg & Avocado Toast
benefits: High in protein, fiber, and good fats
Provides long-lasting energy
Supports brain, muscle, and immune function
instructions: Soften the oats: Soak oats in milk for 5–10 minutes (or microwave for 30 seconds if you prefer it warm).
Blend it all: In a blender, combine soaked oats, banana, peanut butter, milk, chia seeds, Greek yogurt, and honey.
Serve cold or chilled, optionally topped with a few banana slices or crushed nuts.
Toast the bread to your preference.
In a bowl, crack and beat 2 eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper.
In a nonstick pan, scramble the eggs over medium-low heat using a small amount of butter or oil (optional).
Spread or layer avocado slices on the toast.
Top the toast with scrambled eggs, or serve the egg on the side.

lunch.name: Grilled Chicken & Quinoa Super Bowl + Yogurt & Fruit
benefits: Great balance of macronutrients
Supports muscle recovery and gut health
Loaded with iron, potassium, and vitamin C
ingredients: 1 cup steamed mixed vegetables (e.g., broccoli, carrots, beans)
instructions: Cook quinoa: Rinse and cook ½ cup dry quinoa with 1 cup water. Let simmer for ~15 minutes. (Yields ~1 cup cooked.)
Grill chicken: Season chicken breast with salt, pepper, and optional herbs. Grill or pan-sear for ~5–6 minutes per side or until fully cooked. Slice it up.
Steam vegetables: Steam your veggie mix until just tender (5–7 minutes).
Assemble the bowl:
Add quinoa as the base.
Top with grilled chicken, veggies, and sliced avocado.
Drizzle olive oil on top for flavor and healthy fats.

dinner.name: Lentil Pasta with Cheese, Egg, & Roasted Veggies
benefits: Packed with fiber, protein, and complex carbs
Aids post-activity recovery
Easy to digest and satisfying
ingredients: Whole wheat pasta – 1.5 cups cooked (260 kcal)
Roasted sweet potato – ½ cup (100 kcal)
Sautéed spinach or kale – ½ cup (30 kcal)
instructions: Sauté spinach and garlic in olive oil.
Toss cooked pasta with lentils, veggies, and cheese.
Serve topped with a sliced boiled egg and roasted sweet potato on the side.

breakfast.name: High-Fiber Oats & Egg Breakfast Bowl
benefits: High in fiber and healthy fats
Keeps you full longer and stabilizes energy levels
Supports digestion and muscle function
ingredients: Unsweetened almond milk – ¾ cup (30 kcal)
instructions: Cook oats in almond milk until thick.
Stir in peanut butter, chia, cinnamon, and honey.
Top with banana slices.
Serve with a boiled egg on the side.

lunch.name: Grilled Chicken Quinoa Bowl with Yogurt Dressing
benefits: Balanced in protein, complex carbs, and healthy fats
Supports metabolism and satiety
High in vitamins and antioxidants
instructions: Cook quinoa and set aside.
Grill chicken and slice.
Steam vegetables.
Combine in a bowl with avocado and drizzle olive oil.
Mix yogurt with lemon juice and herbs for a simple, light dressing.

dinner.name: Lentil & Veggie Pasta Bowl with Cheese & Egg
benefits: High in fiber and plant-based protein
Supports digestion and muscle maintenance
Low glycemic and great for evening satiety
ingredients: Cooked whole wheat pasta – ¾ cup (165 kcal)
Cooked green lentils – ½ cup (115 kcal)
Roasted zucchini or bell peppers – ½ cup (60 kcal)
instructions: Cook pasta and lentils.
Sauté spinach and veggies in olive oil.
Mix everything together and top with cheese and sliced boiled egg.

breakfast.name: Protein Oats Bowl with Boiled Egg
benefits: High in protein, fiber, and healthy fats

Great for muscle repair and appetite control
instructions: Cook oats in almond milk.
Stir in protein powder, peanut butter, chia seeds, cinnamon, and honey.
Top with banana slices.
Serve with a boiled egg on the side.

lunch.name: Grilled Chicken, Quinoa & Veggie Bowl + Yogurt
benefits: Balanced with lean protein, fiber, and complex carbs
Supports stable blood sugar
Probiotic-rich yogurt aids digestion
ingredients: Lemon juice, pepper, herbs – to taste
instructions: Cook quinoa and set aside.
Grill or pan-sear chicken and slice it.
Steam veggies and plate everything in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and serve with yogurt on the side.

dinner.name: Lentil & Spinach Pasta Bowl with Egg & Cheese
benefits: Excellent plant-protein + fiber combo
Promotes satiety and blood sugar balance
Light but satisfying meal for the evening
ingredients: Whole wheat pasta – 1 cup cooked (175 kcal)
Cherry tomatoes or bell peppers – ½ cup (45 kcal)
instructions: Sauté spinach, garlic, and tomatoes in olive oil.
Stir in lentils and pasta.
Add cheese and mix until creamy.
Top with a sliced boiled egg.

breakfast.name: Protein Oatmeal Bowl + Boiled Egg

benefits: Great for muscle support and fullness

instructions: Grill chicken breast – 150g (250 kcal)
Cook quinoa – ¾ cup (170 kcal)

Serve yogurt on the side or use as a light dressing.

High in fiber, iron, and slow carbs
Keeps you satisfied without heaviness

Roasted bell peppers or zucchini – 1 cup (80 kcal)

Roast veggies and sauté spinach with olive oil and garlic.
Mix everything together, add cheese, and stir until creamy.
Top with sliced boiled egg before serving.

Top with banana and yogurt.
Toast the bread, mash avocado, and top with sliced boiled egg.

lunch.name: Grilled Chicken Power Bowl + Yogurt + Fruit
benefits: Balanced mix of complex carbs, lean protein, and healthy fats
Boosts muscle support and immunity

Fresh berries or sliced apple – 1 cup (120 kcal)
instructions: Grill chicken and steam the vegetables.
Plate with brown rice and avocado.
Drizzle olive oil over the bowl.
Serve fruit and yogurt as dessert or a side.

dinner.name: Grilled Chicken & Sweet Potato Nourish Bowl with Yogurt-Tahini Dressing
benefits: Rich in complex carbs and healthy fats
Lean protein for recovery and muscle repair
Packed with fiber, potassium, magnesium, and antioxidants
Great for post-activity recovery and overnight metabolism
ingredients: Roasted sweet potato – 1 cup cubes (180 kcal)
Cooked bulgur or brown rice – ¾ cup (165 kcal)
Sautéed kale or spinach – ½ cup (30 kcal)
Plain Greek yogurt – ¼ cup (40 kcal)
Lemon juice, garlic, cumin – optional for dressing
Mixed herbs (parsley, mint, etc.) – optional garnish
instructions: Roast sweet potato cubes with a drizzle of olive oil and a pinch of salt (20–25 min at 200°C).
Grill chicken seasoned with pepper, garlic, and a bit of lemon.
Cook bulgur or brown rice and let it rest.
Sauté kale or spinach in ½ tsp olive oil until wilted.
In a small bowl, whisk together yogurt, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and a splash of water to make a creamy dressing.
Assemble your bowl: base of grains, topped with chicken, sweet potato, greens, and avocado. Drizzle with yogurt-tahini sauce and garnish with herbs.
